# Scale: Melodic in G (Mode: Locrian Natural 2)

## Brief Overview
The Melodic scale in G, specifically in the Locrian #2 mode, is a unique and sophisticated musical entity. It is a variation of the traditional Locrian mode with a raised second degree, giving it a distinct flavor that sets it apart from other scales.

## Notes and Intervals
The Melodic scale in G, Locrian #2 mode, consists of the following notes and intervals:
- G (Root)
- A (Major 2nd)
- Bb (Minor 3rd)
- C (Augmented 4th)
- D (Augmented 5th)
- E (Major 6th)
- F (Minor 7th)

## Musical Genre and Flavor
This scale is not as commonly used as some of the more traditional modes, but it can add a mysterious and exotic sound to music when employed effectively. Due to its dissonant intervals and unique character, the Melodic scale in G, Locrian #2 mode, is often found in jazz fusion, progressive rock, and experimental music genres.

## Songs Using the Melodic Scale in G (Locrian #2)
Three songs that utilize the Melodic scale in G, Locrian #2 mode include:
1. "The Dance of Eternity" by Dream Theater
2. "Birdland" by Weather Report
3. "Scarified" by Racer X
